stamp.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a small piece of paper that you buy and stick onto an envelope or package before posting it
stamp.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a tool for pressing or printing a mark or pattern onto a surface, or the mark made by this tool
stamp.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a small piece of paper that is worth a particular amount of money and is bought and collected for something over a period of time
stamp.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a piece of paper for sticking to some official papers to show that British tax has been paid
stamp.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: an act of stamping, especially with your foot
stamp.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to put your foot down onto the ground loudly and with a lot of force
stamp.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: ‘I will not!’ Bert yelled and stamped his foot  (=because he was angry).
She stood at the bus stop stamping her feet  (=because she was cold).
Marta shrieked and started stamping on the cockroach.
stamp.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to walk somewhere in a noisy way by putting your feet down hard onto the ground because you are angry
stamp.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: My mother stamped off down the stairs.
stamp.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to put a pattern, sign, or letters on something, using a special tool
stamp.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The woman at the desk stamped my passport.
Among the papers was a brown folder stamped ‘SECRET’.
Stamp the date on all the letters.
stamp.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to have an important or permanent effect on someone or something
stamp.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: The experience remained stamped on her memory for many years.
His army years had stamped him with an air of brisk authority.
stamp.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to stick a stamp onto a letter, parcel etc
stamp.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a small piece of paper that you buy and stick onto an envelope or package before posting it
stamp.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Care must be taken that the correct postage stamps for overseas post are used.
stamp.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a small piece of paper that is worth a particular amount of money and bought and collected towards paying for something over a period of time
stamp.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a tool for pressing or printing a mark or pattern onto a surface, or the mark made by this tool
stamp.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to put a pattern, sign, or letters on something, using a special tool
stamp.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Stamp the date on all the letters.
Your passport must be stamped with your entry date.
stamp.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to stick a stamp on a letter, parcel etc
